result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerrell Lamar Gaston

records.addlTxt: Signed and filed: Scheduling Order for Jury Trial Dated January 23, 2023
Received and Filed: Proposed Scheduling Order for Jury Trial Dated January 23, 2023

Defendant Jerrell Lamar Gaston appeared by video.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Jerrell Lamar Gaston.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a final pre-trial.  Attorney Graber informs the court that she has not had enough time to touch base with Mr. Gaston and requests to adjourn the jury trial scheduled on November 7, 2022.  No objection from the State.  Court vacates jury trial.  Court rescheduled final pre-trial and jury trial.  Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed by the Court.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed: State's Proposed Jury Instructions
Received and Filed: State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-25-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 9-18-2022

Defendant Jerrell Lamar Gaston in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant appears by Zoom. Court vacates stayed bench warrant. Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report

Attorney Katherine Graber in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for status conference.  Defendant failing to appear.  Defense counsel requests that the Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report

Attorney Katherine Graber in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Off the record via Zoom. Defendant was previously present on Zoom, has since logged off. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Jerrell Lamar Gaston not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Jerrell Lamar Gaston not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jerrell Lamar Gaston in court with Attorney Katherine Graber; both appear by video.  Defendant Jerrell Lamar Gaston in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 14CF3346. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Tyler Zelinski.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Shynell I.B
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jerrell Lamar Gaston in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Jerrell Lamar Gaston in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jerrell Lamar Gaston appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Motion to dismiss by defense for lack of probable cause argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
